title: 113_hr26
content: The "Deferred Benefits Adjustment Act of 2013" may be cited as the Act. It includes provisions for the indexation of deferred annuities. Amendments to Section 8338 of title 5, United States Code, allow for the computation of annuities based on average pay adjustments in the General Schedule rates. Amendments to Section 8338 of title 5, United States Code, allow for the computation of annuities based on average pay adjustments in the General Schedule rates. Average pay for survivor annuities shall be increased based on the commencement date, with a limit not exceeding the highest rate of pay earned by the employee or Member. The average pay for computing deferred annuities is determined by regulations and includes percentage adjustments in General Schedule rates from separation to annuity commencement. If a former employee dies before claiming the annuity, their average pay is used for computation. The average pay used for computing survivor annuities is increased based on the commencement date of the annuity. The increase cannot exceed the rate of basic pay earned at the time of the highest pay rate. The average pay for computing survivor annuities is adjusted based on the annuity's start date. Amendments to the Federal Employees' Retirement System Act of 1986 detail the computation of deferred annuities under specific sections of the title. The computation of survivor annuities under specific sections of the Federal Employees' Retirement System Act of 1986 is detailed in paragraph (9)(A) and (B), with adjustments based on the annuity's start date. The computation of survivor annuities under the Federal Employees' Retirement System Act of 1986 is detailed in specific sections, with adjustments based on the annuity's start date. Conforming amendments are made to sections of title 5, United States Code, regarding former employees or Members. The widow or widower of a deferred annuitant who dies before establishing a valid claim for annuity under CSRS shall be eligible for a survivor annuity in the same way as currently applies under FERS. If an employee or Member dies after separating from service with title to a deferred annuity under section 8338 but before establishing a valid claim for annuity, the widow or widower is entitled to an annuity equal to 55 percent of the deferred annuity, or may choose to receive a lump-sum credit instead if eligible and applies before the annuity is awarded. The widow or widower of a former employee or Member may receive an annuity under certain conditions, with limitations on the amount based on survivor annuity payments to former spouses. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATES. The amendments made by section 2 apply to annuities or survivor annuities starting before, on, or after the enactment date of this Act, with recomputations allowed for those based on service before the Act's enactment. Application for recomputation must be made within 12 months of the effective date of regulations by the Office of Personnel Management. Any change in an annuity or survivor annuity resulting from a recomputation shall only apply to amounts accruing for months after the enactment of this Act. The amendment made by section 3 will be effective as of the enactment date, and can also apply to widows or widowers of former employees who died before that date, with exceptions for certain cases. The lump-sum credit has been voided. A survivor annuity can still be claimed if the individual would have been entitled to it before the enactment of this Act. Definitions for "widow," "widower," and "lump-sum credit" are provided.
